title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default. Create a new basic project and a new file named 'test.xml'. The editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content. Select 'test.xml' in the Navigator, choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor', and observe that nothing happens. It's reactivating the scripted resource editor example. Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. When opening a file with a different editor type, a new editor should be opened on the file.
EB: Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default. Create a new basic project and a new file named 'test.xml'. The editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which ignores the XML file content. Select 'test.xml' in the Navigator, choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor', and observe that a new editor is opened on the file, because the editor type is different.
SR:
1. Create a new basic project.
2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'.
3. Select 'test.xml' in the Navigator.
4. Choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'.
5. Verify that a new editor is opened on the file, indicating that the editor type is different.
